overview_of_class: In this course we will explore uses of performance and social media as tools for activism. We will analyze practices of hacktivism and social media campaigns to understand ways in which activists employ features of performance such as embodiment, liveness, affect, and participant engagement to address and mobilize networked audiences. Course materials include histories of digital activism, performance and tactical media theory, and analyses of selfie and hashtag campaigns. The goal of the course is to develop a historical and theoretical understanding of the efficacy of performance and digital networking as tactical media. The course will alternate between lecture, discussion, and hands-on exercises. For their projects, students will use any number of social media or content management tools (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Snapchat, Storify) as stages for activist performance.
